Title: CMUL alumni invest over N10m in learning facilities
Summary: The 2004 alumni set of the College of Medicine, University of Lagos (CMUL) has launched a give-back project, investing over N10 million in upgrading learning facilities to reaffirm their commitment to infrastructure development, mentorship, and the advancement of medical education .

Title: Benin president says military didn’t support failed coup
Summary: Benin President Patrice Talon says bulk of army did not back foiled coup bid . Talon: "No significant segment of the army joined’s attempted coup of December 7 . Benin president says military didn’t support failed coup which recruited trainee soldiers .

Title: Imo police begin orderly room trial of seven officers over alleged extortion, misconduct
Summary: Imo State police command has commenced the orderly room trial of seven police officers for their alleged involvement in extortion . The seven officers are being tried over alleged extortion and misconduct .

Title: FG urged to review oil sector divestment policies
Summary: An environmental justice advocacy group has urged the incoming leadership of Nigeria’s petroleum regulatory agencies to urgently review and reform oil sector divestment policies . The MIIDEEKOR Environmental Development Initiative (MEDI) warned that existing practices are worsening environmental injustice .

Title: NANS backs presidency on Dangote Refinery, urges protection of local industries
Summary: The National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS) commended the Presidency for recent policy actions aimed at protecting local industries . NANS described the measures as critical to Nigeria's economic survival and long-term development .

Title: COAS announces Army overhaul to tackle rising insecurity
Summary: COAS Lieutenant General Waidi Shaibu warned that Nigeria’s security environment has become ‘increasingly complex’ with rising regional instability and global shifts in warfare .

Title: Katsina State reclaims ₦10b in properties, 38 years after creation
Summary: Katsina State Government has successfully recovered landed properties valued at over ₦10 billion . Nearly 38 years after the state was carved out from former Kaduna State .

Title: NAF C-130 aircraft resumes flight to Portugal after release in Burkina Faso
Summary: NAF C-130 aircraft and its crew, previously detained in Burkina Faso, have resumed their journey to Portugal . The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) aircraft was previously detained .

Title: Lai Mohammed chronicles enduring bond with Buhari in new book
Summary: Lai Mohammed chronicles enduring bond with Buhari in new book . Ex-Minister of Information and Culture, Alhaji Mohammed, unveiled on Wednesday in Abuja .

Title: Ogbo-Ogwu market hands over N265 million worth of fake, expired drugs to NAFDAC
Summary: Bridge Head Medicine Market, popularly known as Ogbo-Ogwu Market in Onitsha, Anambra State, handed over N265 million worth of fake, expired, and substandard drugs to the National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control (NAFDAC)

Title: NAF crew continues Portugal mission from Burkina Faso
Summary: The crew, comprising 11 Nigerian personnel, was on a mission to Portugal for scheduled aircraft maintenance when it made an emergency landing in Burkina Faso . The emergency landing, which occurred in Bobo-Dioulasso on December 8, 2025, was described as a precautionary measure following a technical issue with the aircraft . The spokesperson of

Title: 47.1m Nigerians no longer need treatment for elephantiasis, river blindness — Minister
Summary: 47.1 million Nigerians no longer require treatment for Lymphatic Filariasis (elephantiasis) and Onchocerciasis (river blindness) The project was launched to address a critical gap in Nigeria’s elimination roadmap for the diseases and received $4.9 million in funding support from the Gates Foundation .

Title: Senate screens Tinubu’s nominees for NMDPRA, NUPRC
Summary: The Senate will on Friday confirm President Bola Tinubu’s nominees for the leadership of the two key petroleum regulatory agencies . Saidu Muhammad and Oritsememeyiwa Eyesan will be confirmed following their screening by the Committee of the Whole on Thursday .

Title: Kwara Assembly suspends lawmaker for secretly recording closed-door meeting
Summary: The Kwara State House of Assembly has suspended Saba Gideon, who represents Edu State Constituency, for three months over alleged contempt of the House and breach of legislative privilege . The suspension follows revelations that the lawmaker secretly recorded a closed-door meeting of the Assembly and shared the audio with an unauthorised person .

Title: 2027: 70% Rivers support for Tinubu already secured — Fubara
Summary: Siminalayi Fubara gave the assurance on Thursday during the inauguration of the 9.7km Ogbakiri Road project in Emuoha Local Government Area .
